name: Clean That Castle!
description:
Made for DOMEjam in March 2020

The castle barracks is a mess! Swords, bows, and shields everywhere... I guess it's up to you to... Clean That Castle!

Tidy your way through 10 levels of organisational conundrums by creating matches of 3 or more of each item (sword, bow, shield) so that there are no tiles left in each level. You only have a certain allotment of each tile per level, so take care where you place them!

Controls:
- left/right arrows to move your cursor
- down arrow to drop the currently selected tile
- z to cycle through your available tile types
- x to reset a level if you get stuck

---

Clean That Castle! is made to roughly match the specifications of Panic's Playdate console (https://play.date/) as a fun exercise in making a game for the console even though it's not released yet. As such, the screen size is limited to 400 by 240 pixels and can only use black and white colours!

The game will start up with a window size of 400x240 but you can also press keys 1/2/3 to scale it up to 2x or 3x scale for easier playing.

---

The game's source code is included in the download, alternatively you can visit the project's Github repository at https://github.com/chrislewisdev/domejam
